Most players are content to use the PlayStation VR headset for video games, thanks to a raft of excellent titles for Sony's PlayStation 4 . 
But a few have figured out how to use the £350 gaming accessory to see something a lot naughtier in 360 degress. 
The Sony PlayStation store is firmly controlled by the Japanese company and - like Apple and Google - expressly forbids pornography from appearing. 
But thanks to an app called Littlstar, gamers have found a way to side-load virtual reality content onto the console. Read More US military naked photo investigation expanded into a 'slew' of gay porn websites A man wears a PlayStation VR headset (Photo: Getty) 
An update to the app now allows users to output any full 3D 360 video onto the PlayStation VR headset. 
The content has to be downloaded from the internet first but, using the app, it can be side-loaded through a USB attached to the game console. 
“LittlStar had to request special permissions to have access to the USB port for side loading content,” explained Tony Mugavero, CEO of the app. 
“The player will support 2D and 3D 360 and 180 content, something the PlayStation player does not currently support (they only have basic 2d 360). "We are the only company to have this available, so it is an exclusive feature to LittlStar on the PSVR. The community was asking us for this because Sony does not have a proper player to support it, so this was really an effort for the community." 
Although the app isn't affiliated with pornography, it didn't take gamers long to figure out the fringe benefits of putting your own content on the console. 
VRporn.com told the Daily Star the option to use LittlStar to put your own content on the PS4 was "an important feature for adult media consumption."
